nodes.documentation:
@title Stream smart contract 
 @dev Represents a video transcode job - is created by a client.
 The video is split in chunks; miners submit proofs for each chunk for each bitrate.
 Validators approve miner proofs.
 Because the solidity 0.4.24 compiler does not support ABI encoding for 
 structs(except with the experimental flag which casts all the values to strings)
 we sometimes return the 'destructured' objects.
 The contract holds a list of input chunk ids (_inChunkIds) and of requested bitrates (_bitrates).
 Each requested bitrate has an Outstream and each Outstream stores a dictionary of 
 proof queues mapped for each input chunk. The proof queues store the proofs & ouput chunks
 submited by miners.
nodes.name: Stream

nodes.documentation:
@notice 
 @dev

@notice Manager can add more input chunkIds as they become available
 @dev Reverts if chunk already exists

@notice Signals that the input stream has ended and no more input chunks are available
 @dev Called by manager contract
nodes.name: endStream

nodes.name: ChunkProofSubmited

deposit().details: Anyone that calls the method funds the client account.

getCandidateProof(uint256,uint256).details: Validators should use this to query the current proof canditate before validating it. Returns object with '0' values  if no candidate proof, i.e. all submited proof have been scrapped Reverts if if no proof yet submited or idx out of bounds

getProof(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: Can be used to inspect the proof queue for a given chunk & bitrate. Reverts if bitrate or chunk id do not exist or if idx goes out of range.

getProofCount(uint256,uint256).details: Reverts if bitrate or chunk id do not exist.

getValidProof(uint256,uint256).details: Requires that the proof has been validated.

hasValidProof(uint256,uint256).details: Reverts if bitrate ore chunk id are wrong/not required.

isBitrateTranscoded(uint256).details: Reverts if bitrate is wrong/not required.

scrapProof(uint256,uint256).details: This will increment the proofs queue head to point to the next proof. This we would decrease miner reputation.

submitProof(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint.details: Will not allow new proof submission if already validated, i.e. proofQueue.validator != address(0)

validateProof(uint256,uint256).details: Requires that we have proofs. At the moment we issue a reward of 0.01 VID until we have a wattage/reward calculation. alpha: we added a call to withdraw to actually transfer funds to miner when validating (push payment).

addInputChunkId(uint256).notice: Manager can add more input chunkIds as they become available

deposit().notice: Deposit an amount to escrow on behalf of the client account.

endStream().notice: Signals that the input stream has ended and no more input chunks are available

getCandidateProof(uint256,uint256).notice: Returns the first proof canditate for validation/scraping.

getInChunkCount().notice: Returns the number of chunks the input stream has.

getInChunks().notice: Returns the input chunk ids array.

getOutChunks(uint256).notice: Returns all output chunk ids for the given bitrate only.

getProof(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Returns any proof that has been submited for the given chunk & bitrate from the proof queue.

getProofCount(uint256,uint256).notice: Query proof count for given chunk&bitrate.

getValidProof(uint256,uint256).notice: Returns the proof of a validated chunk.

hasValidProof(uint256,uint256).notice: Returns true if the chunk has been validated

isBitrateTranscoded(uint256).notice: Returns true if the bitrate has valid proofs for every chunk.

isTranscodingDone().notice: Returns true if the stream has valid proofs for every chunk for every bitrate

refund().notice: Cand refund the remaining funds to the client that requested the stream . if allowed by manager.

refundAllowed().notice: Returns true if the manager allows the refund (special case) or if the stream has ended and all the chunks have been transcoder

scrapProof(uint256,uint256).notice: Validators can scrap the first proof available in the queue if they consider so.

submitProof(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint.notice: Miners use the method to submit proofs & output chunkIds

validateProof(uint256,uint256).notice: Validators use the method to validate the first proof available in the queue.
